intro: Lerchia maritima, commonly known as sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers. The plant thrives in salty, well-drained soils and is often found in dune environments. It has narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Lerchia maritima plays an important role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for various insects and birds.
